title: Student Data
question_text:
On the first day of school, a statistics teacher collects data from his $150$ students to use throughout the school year. He collects data on the following topics: $$\text{Height}$$ $$\text{Favorite Class}$$ $$\text{Amount of Sleep Last Night}$$ $$\text{Eye Color}$$
Which of the following would not be considered a variable?
solution:
Solution

In statistics, a variable is a characteristics that changes from one individual to another. We collect information on variables from subjects.

In this problem, data was collected from our subjects, the 150 students, on the following variables: height, eye color, amount of sleep last night, and eye color.

Choice 'A' is correct.

Explanation of Distractors

Choice 'B' is incorrect. Since height is a number that will change from one person to another, it is considered a variable.

Choice 'C' is incorrect. Student's favorite class is a value that could change from student to student, therefore it is a variable.

Choice 'D' is incorrect. Amount of sleep is a numeric value that will change from one person to another, it is also considered a variable.

Choice 'E' is incorrect. Since not everyone's eye color is the same, eye color is also a variable.
